Selfies, they're a social media staple
the world over,

3.text:
and they're usually taken
on one of these.

5.text:
So here are my top tips on how to get
your smartphone selfies just right.

19.text:
First up, perfect lighting is key
to the perfect selfie.

22.text: Large bright sources of light are best.

24.text:
So if you're indoors,
face a bright window of light,

27.text:
or if you're outside,
make sure you've got the sun on your face.

30.text:
Now, if you're on low light,
my top tip is to use the torch

35.text:
Hold the two phones together
so that one's shining light on your face

38.text: and the other one is taking a photo.

44.text:
Trying to get the angle just right on a selfie
is always difficult

47.text:
with hands getting in the way
and the on-screen buttons

52.text:
But if you're using an iPhone
and you have the official headphones,

55.text: there's a little trick you can try.

56.text:
First, plug the headphones in
and switch on the camera app.

59.text: And this is the clever bit.

61.text:
You can use the volume button
on the headphones

63.text:
to take the actual shot,
giving you more space to strike a pose.

70.text: And lastly, the dreaded selfie stick.

73.text:
Now, these poles get
a bit of a hard time.

75.text:
Swallow your pride and whip it out
because they really do the job.

78.text:
Now, the key is to make sure
you don't get the pole in the shot.

81.text:
And if you can do this,
you can improve your picture

83.text:
by being able to capture a wide angle
and give a more flattering perspective.

87.text:
Also, angling the pole a bit higher
will tend to make you look better.

91.text: So those are my top tips.

93.text:
Give them a go on your next selfie spree,
and see your social media status soar.
